alert.note: Alert for Casey; Taylor (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 8:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Taylor and central Casey Counties through 915 PM EDT... At 842 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Campbellsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Liberty around 900 PM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
